page.title: 18Union Chain Bridge
page.content: Towards the end of the 18th century, because of the pressure of the Industrial Revolution,and the inconvenience and danger of the existing ford,Parliamentary permission was given to build a bridge to join the farms and villages of Berwickshire with the lime works and coal pits of North Northumberland. The bridge was built by the Berwick and North Durham Turnpike Trust,the foundation stone was laid on August 2nd 1819 and the bridge opened to vehicular traffic on 26th July 1820.
